column4: How could I make downloads to be faster under Ubuntu? I have 56k modem but the downloadspeed for example at synaptic is something like 400-800 bytes per second.
use the repositories that are best for you (often nearest geographic location)
sorry, I don't understand what you mean. you mean I should download from the nearest location?
yeah, that would most likely be the fastest
it's always max 0.8kbps. even when downloading from finland (where I'm from) with firefox. Is there some settings I should change with the modem?
hmm. i dunno.. so many years since i used a modem .... but if it's always 0.8 it seem to be a config error somewhere
very possible, I'm new to linux and I have to guess most of the options. :)
i think it works w/ cedega
solved you speed-problmes?
nope, still downloading stuff with synaptic. they time out when I surf the ubuntuforums at the same time, so now I only IRC and wait the downloads finish themselves.
aouch :<
ubuntu w/ gnome is no 'lighter' than windows xp
well, atleast this is lighter than Mandrake on defaultsettings. It was installed at this computer (500mhz celeron with 128sdr-ram) and it kept swapping.
well, lighter than mandrake could be, but you compared it with windows xp :)
anyways, if you want even faster loading, less swapping etc i'd recommend you to use XFCE or icewm as windowmanagers instead of gnome
I've got to admit that I didn't even try to install XP to this. :) I just though that XP = ~mandrake when it comes to "heavyness".
ubuntu w/ gnome = xp in 'heaviness'
but as i said, if you wanna quicken up stuff, use icewm or xfce

I got 2 x 64mb of sdr more to this so there's no more swapping now. Are XFCE and icewm as easy (and this is important, this computer is going to be with my parents "alone" for half an year") and windows-like?
i think they're easy.. but you could have trouble connecting usb devices perhaps...
just apt-get them and try them out ;) i'd recommend xfce firsthand.. think it's more noob-friendly for you parents =)
uh oh. this has to have digital camera support (usb). I haven't even tried to get that working yet.
that's no-pain in gnome at least.. i had to struggle abit with it in xfce, but i had done the serverinstall for that system so maybe you wont hae to tweak around at all
